dlgPart.npc_text:
“My door is always open to the faithful,” says a nobleman, wearing a robe and a turban. The robe is lavishly decorated with golden embroidery and probably worth a small fortune.
“I’m Marcus Sidonius Fabianus, the Second Acolyte, but you can call me Brother Marcus.”

“Brother Meru is the First Acolyte,” says the nobleman, his facial expression inviting you to connect the dots. “My family is the second in Ganezzar. Thus, the title of the *Second* Acolyte is mine without contestation.”

“My family has sworn an oath to serve House Crassus hundreds of years ago. Lord Meru’s Creed is my Creed,” says the nobleman proudly. “When he fights, I fight! When he kneels, I kneel! Where he goes, I follow!”

dlgAnsw.text: “What do the responsibilities of the Second Acolyte entail?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Gods be with you, <brother/sister>,” says the nobleman, clearly enjoying his role of the Second Acolyte.

“When the Gods return to establish their Kingdom, Brother Meru will be elevated above all men and granted Kingship. As the Second Acolyte, I will stand a step behind him and assist him in carrying out his duties. It is the highest honor,” adds the nobleman, as if unsure that you can grasp such an important detail.

dlgAnsw.text: “What makes you think the Gods will make Meru a king?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“The true Kingship comes from heaven,” says the nobleman, raising his finger. “Much like a lord can’t attend to every detail and needs trusted servants to do his will and look after his domain, the Gods will need men pure of heart *and* blood, of course, to do their will and administer their Kingdom.
“There is no other way,” adds the nobleman with certainty.

dlgAnsw.text: “And blood, eh? What happened to ‘we’re all brothers and sisters’?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “We are,” the nobleman gives you a fake smile, “but even amongst brothers and sisters, there are those who are born first, whose destiny is to lead and inherit, and those who are born last whose destiny is to serve the firstborn and follow their lead.”

“The Gods determine your station,” says the nobleman, saddened by your ignorance. “If one’s meant to plough soil, one is born to a farmer. Brother Meru has been chosen to herald the Gods’ return. Do you think he could have done it, had he been born a farmer?”

dlgAnsw.text: “So all these people in Lowtown are –”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Misguided,” the nobleman says quickly. “Their hearts are in the right place, of course, but due to their low birth they aren’t equipped to understand matters of philosophical nature. They speak of freedom but spread chaos.” He shakes his head.
“Did your master send you to gloat? Tell that moneychanger that his day will come.”
“I for one welcome our Aurelian overlords,” says the former Second Acolyte, showing no trace of former piety.
